annual crop land: Presence of farm equipment or machinery
Unpaved, dirt roads or pathways between fields
forest: Uneven terrain with natural features (e.g., hills, streams, rocks)
brushland or shrubland: Often found in regions with seasonal fires as part of the natural cycle
Variety of shrubs and small trees
Presence of wildlife or natural flora
industrial buildings or commercial build: Presence of vehicles such as trucks or cars
Man-made constructions such as factories, warehouses, or offices
Presence of signage indicating commercial or industrial use
pasture land: Patches of different types of grasses and wildflowers
Less variability in plant species compared to a forest
permanent crop land: Irrigation systems: Permanent crops often have more elaborate irrigation systems in place.
residential buildings or homes or apartm: Family-oriented structures such as playgrounds, mailboxes, or outdoor seating areas
river: Presence of wildlife, such as fish, birds, or plants
Visible banks or shores on both sides
lake or sea: Aquatic vegetation like reeds or lily pads
